info.title: Sui JSON-RPC
info.description: Sui JSON-RPC API for interaction with the Sui network gateway.

methods.name: sui_transferCoin
methods.description: Create a transaction to transfer a Sui coin from one address to another.

methods.name: sui_moveCall
methods.description: Execute a Move call transaction by calling the specified function in the module of a given package.

methods.name: sui_executeTransaction
methods.description: Execute the transaction using the transaction data, signature and public key.

methods.name: sui_getOwnedObjects
methods.description: Return the list of objects owned by an address.

methods.name: sui_getObjectInfoRaw
methods.description: Low level API to get object info. Client Applications should prefer to use `get_object_typed_info` instead.

AuthorityQuorumSignInfo.description: Represents at least a quorum (could be more) of authority signatures.

AuthoritySignature.description: A signature emitted by an authority. It's useful to decouple this from user signatures, as their set of supported schemes will probably diverge

oneOf.description: An object whose governing logic lives in a published Move module
Map from each module name to raw serialized Move module bytes

Event.description: User-defined event emitted by executing Move code. Executing a transaction produces an ordered log of these

updated_coin.description: The updated original coin object after merge

updated_gas.description: The updated gas payment object after deducting payment

owner.description: The owner that unlocks this object

previous_transaction.description: The digest of the transaction that created or last mutated this object

storage_rebate.description: The amount of SUI we would rebate if this object gets deleted. This number is re-calculated each time the object is mutated based on the present storage gas price.

oneOf.description: Object is exclusively owned by a single address, and is mutable.
Object is exclusively owned by a single object, and is mutable. The object ID is converted to SuiAddress as SuiAddress is universal.

created_objects.description: List of Move objects created as part of running the module initializers in the package

package.description: The newly published package object reference.

updated_gas.description: The updated gas payment object after deducting payment

oneOf.description: Initiate a coin transfer between addresses
Call a function in a published Move module

new_coins.description: All the newly created coin objects generated from the split

updated_coin.description: The updated original coin object after split

updated_gas.description: The updated gas payment object after deducting payment

owner.description: The owner that unlocks this object

previous_transaction.description: The digest of the transaction that created or last mutated this object

storage_rebate.description: The amount of SUI we would rebate if this object gets deleted. This number is re-calculated each time the object is mutated based on the present storage gas price.

digest.description: Base64 string representing the object digest

objectId.description: Hex code as string representing the object id

TransactionDigest.description: A transaction will have a (unique) digest.

TransactionEffects.description: The response from processing a transaction or a certified transaction

dependencies.description: The set of transaction digests this transaction depends on.

events.description: The events emitted during execution. Note that only successful transactions emit events

TransactionEnvelope_for_AuthorityQuorumS.description: A transaction signed by a client, optionally signed by an authority (depending on `S`). `S` indicates the authority signing state. It can be either empty or signed. We make the authority signature templated so that `TransactionEnvelope<S>` can be used universally in the transactions storage in `SuiDataStore`, shared by both authorities and non-authorities: authorities store signed transactions, while non-authorities store unsigned transactions.

auth_sign_info.description: authority signature information, if available, is signed by an authority, applied on `data`.

tx_signature.description: tx_signature is signed by the transaction sender, applied on `data`.

VersionedID.description: Rust version of the Move Sui::ID::VersionedID type
